DOC.detailed_description: Intrahepatic cholestasis pregnancy ( ICP ) pregnancy-specific liver disease . The frequent laboratory abnormality elevation serum bile acid level ICP . Bile acids increase maternal fetal circulation ICP . The bile acid demonstrate cause arrhythmia abnormal calcium dynamic culture neonatal rat cardiomyocytes . Raised maternal bile acid level associate fetal distress arrhytmia fetus . P-wave dispersion ( PWD ) define difference maximum minimum P-wave duration measure 12-lead surface electrocardiogram ( ECG ) . Increased P-wave duration PWD report various clinical setting , include atrial flutter , coronary artery disease , hypertension , rheumatic mitral stenosis , mitral annular calcification , obstructive sleep apnea , obesity . So investigators think bile acid may alter maternal cardiomyocyte function fetus . The investigator hypothesize PWD p wave duration may affect pregnancy ICP . The aim study investigate maternal P-wave duration dispersion change pregnant woman intrahepatic cholestasis pregnancy .
